instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent green light/power
threads.message:
So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. No obvious liquid spill but some green probe points from humidity
Will always power from battery, however if using charger only behaviour is random
Sometimes no green light, sometimes green light but no boot, sometimes it'll boot like normal
Once on it will stay on.
My PP3V42 is there, but I could swear it sometimes takes a few seconds to come up
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is sometimes 12.2V, sometimes 12.6V.

This is very weird behaviour and I don't see anything obvious around SMC or <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent green light/power
threads.message:
If you always get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on charger only, then input leakage is discarded; even when the voltage value is just 12.2V.

Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 amd 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Resolder entire area and inspect for corrosion.

Post PM_BATLOW_ , <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> when doesn't want to turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent green light/power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61561, member: 682"]
If you always get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on charger only
[/QUOTE]
sorry i should've said, I'm using 85W magsafe cable on bench psu. if it makes a difference

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent green light/power
threads.message:
Ooops, then check if you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with original charger.
ALWAYS use original charger.
Lab PSU is good to discard leakage, but not recommended as normal power.
You could have a leakage issue, hidden by lab PSU...
